review: This app has honestly helped me so much when it‚Äôs either trying to fall asleep or trying to deal with stress and sadness. This app can tailor to whatever you may need in your life and highly recommend it, even though it is a little pricy, it still pays off.
title: Amazing

review: So when you first open the app you feel as though you HAVE to pay or subscribe to get to the next screen. The only way you can even find out that they make you pay monthly for this crap is too first give them personal information like first and last name and email.

These people are leeches and know nothing of mindfulness if they have to ask you for your money and personal information before anything else. Not today and not never, good try.

title: Health Care Provider in 2020

review:
I‚Äôm only three days into the beginner course. I‚Äôd like it a lot more if the teacher (Eva) paused between sentences, but instead you have no time to process what she said before she‚Äôs onto the next instruction. 

Example: ‚ÄúNow let your mind do whatever it wants to do now take a deep breath now feel your body in your chair now congratulations you‚Äôre done.‚Äù It‚Äôs actually stressful! PAUSE BETWEEN INSTRUCTIONS. Give me a minute or even 30 seconds to try what you just asked me to do.

I‚Äôd change teachers, but the other woman has a lisp and I don‚Äôt like the English guy‚Äôs voice. I‚Äôm being overly picky, I know. 

I guess it‚Äôs just not the meditation app for me.
title: Meh - like listening to one long run-on sentence

review: This is one of the few apps I will pay for, because it‚Äôs not an app. It‚Äôs having mental health. The app is just the interface - the convenient method through which we access this content. Thank you for your teaching.

It‚Äôs just that Andy has does a good job of making it approachable.
title: A Beginners Guide to Meditation

review:
Overall a great app.

Positives: Great meditations, soothing speakers, great visuals. I like that they keep a tracker of how you feel over the course of a month. Additional articles to read.

Negatives: A lot of content is locked behind a subscription. I get it but, they give you just a little in terms of free. I‚Äôm talking one session, two tops.

Others of Note: I‚Äôm stuck listening to Kevin Hart when I run. I don‚Äôt personally like the man for a racist birthday party he held for his son (I‚Äôm indigenous). I wish I could have options to listen to other speakers like in guided meditation in their application. When I think ‚Äúmindful runs‚Äù I don‚Äôt go straight to Kevin Hart of all people. Makes me want to stay in.
title: Not bad

review: this app has gotten me through some really rough panic attacks, esp during quarentine. there‚Äôs this really amazing feature on the home page that‚Äôs called the panic button, and it is the best grounding tool i‚Äôve ever used. I highly recommend it, thank you so much devs!

review:
A cannonical issue with any "brand" is they always feel to add more.

Marketing and MBAs clearly have their clutches in this app now.   We have tons of new "features" that have nothing to do with the basics of meditation.

The basics of headspace, which are fundamental to mindfulness are now hidden.   They are there but now you have one hundred things obscuring accessibility including annoying pop-ups for celebrity content.   

Hopefully the Headspace team will find a way to come to their senses and eliminate all these chaotic bells and whistles that have nothing to do with cultivating mindfulness, serenity.

review:
Several sleep casts only feature BIPOC voices when they‚Äôre tied to stereotypical roles.

For example, Carlos (spanish accent) only featured in El Mercado. Brian (Asian accent) only featured in Temple Rain. Kim (African American woman) only featured in Salon Nights.

Including diverse voice actors across all the sleep casts could undermine the typical tropes western cultures have historically imposed on ‚Äúother‚Äù identities. 

There‚Äôs an opportunity to challenge the historically prejudiced stereotypes that maintain that certain identities can  only exist  if fitting into well-worn mischaracterizations. 

Please reconsider how to cast voice actors.
title: Diverse voices
developerResponse: {'id': 20561838, 'body': "Thank you for feedback and we're sorry to hear you‚Äôre not completely satisfied with our voice talent choices in the Sleepcasts. I‚Äôm not sure what headspace is about.

Stress relief?
 Sure.
 The breathing exercise is excellent. 
Meditation?
 Okay.
 I‚Äôm a Zen Buddhist; this program is like Zen, minus the Buddhism. 
Sleep facilitation?
 Here‚Äôs where it gets tricky.

I don‚Äôt see a way to set up a get-to-sleep regimen.
 Having to fool with a computer (iPhone) seems antithetical to getting to sleep.
 Why can‚Äôt I set up up a ‚Äúplay stuff like XYZ,‚Äù and have done with it?

That‚Äôs all for now...

review: This app is versatile, fresh and wellness focused with a clean, approachable and attractive aesthetic. I love it! I have been using it for a long time and it pleasantly gets better and better with time. It really helps with anxiety, sleep trouble, anger and now so many other areas of challenge in life. I think there‚Äôs something for everyone‚Äîregardless of background‚Äîto benefit from in the app. My partner and I enjoy doing meditations and Move exercises together. They seem to always be adding more and improving in ways that I previously had silently wished they would. As for possible improvements, I‚Äôd really like to be able to ‚Äúshuffle‚Äù or choose a random sleepcast, specifically. Also, it would be nice if I could rewind the sleepcast, as sometimes I miss the beginning or certain parts while I‚Äôm settling in, or still have stuff on my mind from the day and don‚Äôt want to go through the whole wind down exercise again. Another suggestion‚Äîand this may just be an issue with my older Apple TV‚Äîif I could airplay the video along with the audio (Move exercises, The Wake Up) that would be fantastic as right now only audio plays on the tv while I have to watch the fitness instructor from the phone. One last thing, how about Apple Watch compatibility? That would be delightful and I would use it even more often. Any small flaws or teensy inconveniences aside, it‚Äôs still well worth the small fee to support the people who make this great service available to us.
title: Wholesome & Effective Wellness Hub!

review: Ever since I started headspace I‚Äôve fallen asleep in five minutes or so. With the rainy day antiques it‚Äôs amazing!!
title: I love this app

review: Headspace is a true focus on the practice of mindfulness. Instructional and guided for long term results. Not a series of licensed opportunities for celebrities or influencers like Calm.

review: I have had a subscription to this app for a very long time. I first started using it for sleep.  I could never fall asleep... I would toss and turn for hrs, sometimes all night and not even get a min of sleep. This was extremely frustrating and it was affecting many aspects of my life in a negative way.  I have chronic back pain, and I could never get comfortable, so I thought about this pain all night. My mind racing, knowing that I had work in the morning and I was just miserable.  So, I started using the wind downs.  I incorporated that with a beginners course on meditation.  After some time and practice, I was beginning to see real improvement.  Then I added the sleep stories, I didn‚Äôt think they would work at first, because I believed that the story would have me too focused on the story and not fall asleep. Again, after a week or two, I was falling asleep before the story ended.  Then I did the pain course...to help me understand my relationship with pain.  It did wonders. Over months I was dedicating at least one time a day to meditation.  I also have anxiety, and have been working on that.  But there is so much more on this app. Yoga, healthy eating, music, and a lot of helpful info and meditations.  I have tried other apps while using this one. Some were pretty good and some just weren‚Äôt for me. This app is honestly an app I can‚Äôt live without.  I love it!  I am living a healthier lifestyle and also sleeping so much better. I recommend this app to ANYONE & everyone.  They add new courses and different aspects to it all the time.  I will NEVER cancel this app.  I have begun to look at life different. My mood is more positive, I am focusing more, and I encourage anyone looking for a place to start a meditation journey to start with this app.  There‚Äôs so much information and I can‚Äôt go a day without it.  It‚Äôs the best out there!

review: My son bought me Headspace for my birthday ü•≥ last year after I had talked with him about a perceived crisis I was having. My son is 38, I am 68 and we are very close. He said ‚Äúdo you meditate?‚Äù I thought then said ‚Äúwell no I wouldn‚Äôt know where to start.‚Äù When my birthday rolled around he told me he purchased a year of Headspace so I could learn to meditate. That is the most thoughtful gift üéÅ I have ever received. I was feeling like I was having a meltdown starting on the inside, so I started the impermanence process. My day starts better with the little bit of time I devote to myself. There are many issues I am working on and the more I examine the list in Headspace I see they have a session for each issue. I am certainly on a journey that is aiding me with the tools and skills to manage issues better. I use to have a difficult time getting to sleep and now I put on Rainday Antiques to help me sleep and I have yet to hear it to the end... I am sleeping very well. With the discipline of having the breathing to center me and give me a moment or two to get a perspective rather than react I feel much more in control. I am so not there yet (where ever there is üòÇ) and I feel that Headspace will always have a session for me on this wonderful journey my son gifted me.  After a bit of Headspace I feel able to meet my day with the idea every day is a journey of something different and exciting to explore. I thank Headspace for being a wonderful part of my life‚Äôs journey.
title: I never really knew how to meditate ‚ÄºÔ∏è

review: Headspace‚Äôs meditation teachers taught me so much about mindfulness and I‚Äôve been mediating afford two years as a high schooler. And Andy was a former Buddhist monk, so I learned sooo much about mindfulness that it‚Äôs improving my quality of life A LOT. There are so many things I want to say but I want to keep this short. Even though mediation sounds ‚Äòdumb‚Äô for some people, Headspace is the very opposite; it gives me mindfulness tips and follow up with a mediation, making the mindfulness lesson more memorable, and what I learned so far (and all of them are so freaking helpful) are: observe thoughts instead of reacting and getting carried away with them, if we‚Äôre reacting to thoughts we are keeping the emotion alive, adding more fuel to the fire; let‚Äôs thoughts come and go, with a gentle or effortless focus; having a daydream sense of mind let‚Äôs us take things less seriously and it gives us more freedom, and sooooo many more (I can‚Äôt remember all at the moment). But some improvements I‚Äôd want to see are: being able to review the daily mediations in the ‚ÄúToday‚Äù tab, because they are so freaking useful and I want to keep listening to them, I don‚Äôt want them to be just ‚Äúdaily‚Äù, I want it to exist in the library forever; another improvement is that it‚Äôs kind of expensive for high schoolers, and since I‚Äôm a high schooler and I think this app should be used more by students, I think it should have a reduced price for high schoolers as well (thankfully I got a free one-year trial and I‚Äôm waiting for the sale, because I‚Äôm paying using my own money).
